Package: gov.noaa.messageapi.interfaces

[Java] Interface IField

  • The IField is a fundamental, value-oriented unit in MessageAPI. IFields are defined outside of code in a session spec and must have a globally unique id for that session. Id and Name are the same parameter. The type of the IField describes what type the value is and is used in validation, routing, and optimization. As values can be any type of object, types are required to help the system with typing.

    Authors:
    Ryan Berkheimer

    • Properties Summary

        Properties 
        Type Name and description
        java.lang.String  type
        java.lang.Object  value

    • Methods Summary

        Methods 
        Type Params Return Type Name and description
        java.lang.String getId()
        Returns the ID of the field.
        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the same thing as getId.
        java.lang.String getType()
        Returns the type of the field (i.e., 'string', 'integer', or some user defined object like 'cat').
        java.lang.Object getValue()
        Returns the value of the field.
        java.lang.Boolean isRequired()
        Used contextually to determine whether or not this field is required for subsequent processing.
        java.lang.Boolean isValid()
        Used contextually to determine whether or not this field is valid.
        void setType(java.lang.String type)
        Allows setting of the type of the field as a string.
        void setValid(java.lang.Boolean valid)
        Sets true or false whether or not the field is valid against some generalized criteria
        void setValue(java.lang.Object value)
        sets the value of the field.

    • Property Detail

      • java.lang.String type

      • java.lang.Object value

    • Method Detail

      • public java.lang.String getId()

        Returns the ID of the field. IDs must be globally unique in the context of a session.

      • public java.lang.String getName()

        Returns the same thing as getId. Will be deprecated in an upcoming release.

      • public java.lang.String getType()

        Returns the type of the field (i.e., 'string', 'integer', or some user defined object like 'cat').

      • public java.lang.Object getValue()

        Returns the value of the field. Any type that is valid in Java is valid here.

      • public java.lang.Boolean isRequired()

        Used contextually to determine whether or not this field is required for subsequent processing.

      • public java.lang.Boolean isValid()

        Used contextually to determine whether or not this field is valid. This could be used in type validation or some other way.

      • public void setType(java.lang.String type)

        Allows setting of the type of the field as a string.

      • public void setValid(java.lang.Boolean valid)

        Sets true or false whether or not the field is valid against some generalized criteria

      • public void setValue(java.lang.Object value)

        sets the value of the field.
